general: Cefoperazone is a 3rd-generation parenteral extended-spectrum cephalosporin.
Originally FDA-approved in the early 1980s but now discontinued from the US market.

adult_dose.severe_infections: Up to 4 gm IV q12h in severe infections
adult_dose.uncomplicated_gonococcal_urethritis: 500 mg IM as a single dose

pediatric_dose.dose_age_gt_28_days: 50-200 mg/kg/day (divided q8-12h) (divided q12h if age <8 days)

renal_adjustment.notes: Dosage adjustment may be required in hepatic disease.
renal_adjustment.crcl_or_egfr: No dosage adjustment for renal impairment (if GFR <18, do not exceed 4 gm/day)
renal_adjustment.hemodialysis: No dosage adjustment (AD on dialysis days)

hepatic_adjustment.note: Limit dosage to 2 gm/day in patients with concomitant hepatic and renal dysfunction.

adverse_effects: May increase INR and cause bleeding, possibly related to the MTT side chain.

pregnancy_risk.fda_risk_category: No evidence of toxicity in humans or animals
pregnancy_risk.lactation: Milk concentrations low, adverse effects not expected. Monitor infant for GI toxicity.
pregnancy_risk.footnote: Capital letter = Old FDA risk category; Text = New FDA risk category
